title: Jeffrey Epstein and a Music Company Plan
summary: This article talks about Jeffrey Epstein, a man who did bad things to women. He thought about investing in a music company called EMI. His friend David Stern told him that the music industry was connected to women, which Epstein called "P." Stern sent emails to Epstein about this idea. Epstein was interested and asked if they needed help from someone named Mandelson. Stern was a businessman who knew important people like Prince Andrew and helped with money problems. The emails show that Stern often talked about deals and sent news about EMI's money troubles. EMI was a big music company that doesn't exist anymore. The article uses some offensive words to describe how Epstein talked about women. It is based on emails released by the US government.

background_read: This article is about Jeffrey Epstein, a convicted sex offender, and his associate David Stern. They discussed investing in EMI, a music company, with Stern suggesting it could provide access to women, referred to as "P" in emails. The emails were released by the US Department of Justice, revealing their conversations about deals and connections to people like Lord Mandelson and Prince Andrew. EMI was a major music industry player that faced financial troubles and no longer exists. The article uses this to show how Epstein might have used business investments for inappropriate purposes.
